article_title: BP’s Cuts May Wound Portfolio Recovery--Heard on the Street
article_text:
BP doesn’t lack experience in handling a crisis. The U.K. oil and gas company is chopping its planned capital investment for this year to $20 billion, down from earlier guidance of $24 to $26 billion and 13% lower than 2014’s total.

Allied with the promise of cost cutting and an emphasis on the importance of its dividend, that should reassure investors rattled by oil’s drop. But BP also risks sharpening focus on its longer-term...

twitter.description: BP’s plan to cut spending is reassuring given the sharp drop in oil prices. But they play into lingering concerns about the quality of the oil and gas company’s asset portfolio.
twitter.creator: @helenwsj

But BP also risks sharpening focus on its longer-term...
Allied with the promise of cost cutting and an emphasis on the importance of its dividend, that should reassure investors rattled by oil’s drop.
BP doesn’t lack experience in handling a crisis.
The U.K. oil and gas company is chopping its planned capital investment for this year to $20 billion, down from earlier guidance of $24 to $26 billion and 13% lower than 2014’s total.
